Package edu.uw.pce.advjava.db

Class DerbyEmbeddedNetworkServer

java.lang.Object
edu.uw.pce.advjava.db.DerbyEmbeddedNetworkServer
public class DerbyEmbeddedNetworkServer extends Object
A Derby embedded network server.
Author:
Russ Moul

  • Method Details

    • startNetworkServer

      public void startNetworkServer() throws Exception
      Setting the derby.drda.startNetworkServer property to true, either in the System properties as we do here or in the derby.properties file will cause Network Server to start as soon as Derby is loaded. To load Derby we just need to load the embedded Driver with: Class.forName("org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDriver").newInstance(); Then we will test for a while and make sure it is up, before we give up. Alternately Network Server might be started from the command line or from some other program. Note: only the JVM that starts Network Server can make an embedded connection.
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to start the server

    • getEmbeddedConnection

      public Connection getEmbeddedConnection(String dbName, String attributes, boolean inMemory) throws SQLException
      Used to return an embedded Derby connection The protocol used is "jdbc:derby:dbName" where dbName is the database name The derby embedded JDBC driver must be loaded before calling this method. Alternately, if the derby network server is started in this JVM, then the embedded driver org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDriver is already loaded and it need not be loaded again.
      Parameters:
      dbName - database name (ie location of the database)
      attributes - attributes for the database connection example, "create=true;upgrade=true"
      inMemory - indicate if the database is to be embedded or not
      Returns:
      returns embedded database connection
      Throws:
      SQLException - in the event of a database error

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down the (Derby) database.

    • createServerFromDdl

      public static DerbyEmbeddedNetworkServer createServerFromDdl(String dbName, Reader ddlReader, String username, String password, boolean inMemory, boolean verbose) throws SQLException, IOException
      Creates an embedded server and initialized it using the provided database name, DDL, username and password.
      Parameters:
      dbName - the datbase name
      ddlReader - source of the DDL
      username - the username
      password - the password
      inMemory - true indicates an in memory database
      verbose - enables verbose output
      Returns:
      the created server
      Throws:
      SQLException - if any SQL or database errors occur
      IOException - id any errors occur processing the DDL
